content.detailedDescription:
Sighting report:   date and time: approximately 4:50 am fri.
 3/18/2005 columbia, mo, west side of town around 1500 west, 500
 south on city street grid.

weather conditions: about 40 degrees f, clear skys.

i was driving inside a residential neighborhood in the city and
 noticed an unusually bright light very low, tree top level
 almost, estimate about 1/2 mile away. the light was the color of
 the orange street lights (sodium?) but brighter than a street
 light. it was moving very slowly northward. after a few minutes
 my route turned me east toward the light. i saw it again, still
 low and slow and moving northward, for a short period. this time
 i noticed several smaller and dimmer lights in a horizontal row
 behind the bright light, also of the same orange color. i did
 not notice a blinking red light or any other lights that i would
 expect to see on an airplane or helicopter. the lights moved out
 of view and i never saw them again.

i noticed no sound, although i probably was too far away to hear
 if there was sound.

i would guess that this was a helicopter. hospitals in the area
 have helicopter ambulances. however, it still was like nothing
 that i have seen before. 

submitted in case this description correlates with something else
 that has been reported.

Sighting report:   i was at home one afternoon in the spring of
 1988 in mendenhall, ms. i lived on a farm so there was quite a
 bit of open space so i could see for good distances. it was a
 beautiful day and the sun was just beginning to go down. i
 decided to go outside to enjoy the sunset that day. when i
 walked outside the sun was going down just to my right.  i
 watched for a few minutes then i happened to look off to my
 left. about 1000 feet away to my left was the beginning of my
 aunt92s property. just across the fence that separated our
 property was her feed mill which stood about the height of a two
 story house. the closest thing to the feed mill was a tree which
 was about 3-400 feet to the left of the feed mill. i don=92t know
 why i looked over there but when i did, i saw a beautiful light
 orange ball between the feed mill and the tree. my very first
 thought was it was the moon, then i quickly realized it could
 not been the moon. it was very beautiful, one of the prettiest
 oranges i=92ve ever seen. it did not take me long to realize that
 the ball was actually hovering between the tree and the feed
 mill. i knew that this was something very strange and something
 i would remember the rest of my life. i watched it for a few
 minutes, then started thinking i may be crazy for thinking it
 might be a ufo. i looked back at the sunset just for a moment. i
 remember feeling as though i were being watched. when i looked
 back at the orange ball, it was gone. i did not tell anyone for
 years. i finally told my cousin, who lives in the same area. he
 told me about similar experiences. the difference is that the
 orange ball chased a man to his truck, in one of the stories.

Sighting report:   i am a fi trainee reporting here a sighting my
 sister had on the evening of january 28th of this year. i
 apologize for any lack of data or other such shortcomings.  i am
 new to investigations.  

my sister was driving south on highway 61 in hastings, mn en
 route to winona when she spotted a bright, oval shaped white
 light southeast of her position.  there were scattered clouds
 and the moon was fully visible.  this object appeared at
 approximately the 3-4 o clock position relative to the moon and
 my sister assumed that it was the light of an oncoming plane
 that she was seeing until it began to perfom some very
 remarkable movements.  from its stationary position it rapidly
 decended vertically to near the horizon level and hovered.  it
 seemed either to be wobbling or to be flashing lights, the
 clouds made it difficult to tell.  the object then performed a
 sharp u-turn and reversed direction to head directly upwards
 approximately 1/3 the distance it had initially decended, then
 stopped again.  after a second or two the object shot off with
 incredible speed to the northeast before disappearing.  

she had managed to reach me by cell phone during the sighting and
 was obviously excited and seemed certain that she had seen no
 ordinary aircraft.  unfortunately the object left the area
 before she was able to take pictures with the camera she had
 with her in her car (she was too busy giving me information over
 the phone).  also of note is the fact that she saw a vehicle
 pulled over to the side of the road with a man and his child
 watching the object through binoculars.  the lack of star
 visibility and absence of any other aircraft in the vicinity
 makes it more than likely that the man and his son were
 interested in the ufo.

i plan to contact the local faa to see if i can get any more
 information.  i will naturally supply any information
 forthcoming.

Sighting report:   october 26,2005 at approximatly 10:00 a.M. we
 were traveling west bound on route 202 in south hadely headed
 toward holyoke when a matalic reflection of an object about the
 size of a small car moved at a high rate of spead low in the sky
 in front of us.  then the reflection quickley dulled and in
 broad blue sky the whole thing disapeared.  it was terrifying
 and in the direction we were going.  later another driver
 disclosed that him and his wife also had seen it over holyoke
 from route 391.  i made a report of it at holyoke community
 collage s police department.  please contact me so i know it s
 been loged some where.

Sighting report:   as i was driving up route 44 in winsted, ct, i
 was driving past the winsted animal hospital at approximately
 6:00 p.M. i saw at a 45 degree angle, if one were looking at a
 clock the object was at 1:00 in the sky.  it was a pink,
 circular shape that appeared to look like it had a pink diamond
 that was sparkling in the middle.  it lasted for approximately
 10 seconds and it went from appearing rather large to vanishing.

Sighting report:   in 1947 while living in arkansas, i observed
 an object passing over tyronza, arkansas that was on fire with a
 very long fiery tail trailing behind it. the object was
 traveling from east to west at approximately 15 degrees
 southwest. i checked our paper the next day, but did not see any
 reference to the object. it was not until years later i learned
 about the roswell incident that i thought about the incident
 seriously. during that time we lived in the country and watched
 what we called "shooting stars" almost nightly. this object was
 obviously not a shooting star. it was low enough so that if i
 had not been so awe struck, i probably could have heard the
 noise from the flames. the tail trailing the object was very
 long and sustained until it went out of site. i checked the
 location of roswell nm in reference to tyronza and i truly
 believe this was the object that crashed near roswell, nm. i
 also do not believe the explanation given by the us airforce.

Sighting report:   i was driving down rt 1 when my son asked me
 to stop. so i pulled to the side. he then pointed to the
 ceiling. at first i was confused until i relized he was pointing
 towardes the sky. as i looked up i noticed a strig of lights
 that seemed to be in a formation. well it kinda looked like a
 males unmentionable. so we stared at it in a matter of minutes
 is had spun around a couple of timed then it seemed to vanish
 like it was never there. i have reported it to the local police.
 but the report was never finalized due to a lake of evidence.

Sighting report:   on oct 22nd about 10:30 pm about 5 miles from
 lax airport on i-10 we saw what appeared to my husband and i to
 be planes lining up for landing. as we got closer we realized
 the lights we were watching were not planes. there were 4 lights
 in a diamond shape. they were white in color, approximately 50
 yards apart from each other and maybe 60 feet above the ground.
 we were traveling west and the lights were moving very slowly
 going north. as they crossed over i-10 we stopped on the side of
 the interstate and i grabbed my video camera. they moved
 directly over top of us. we thought maybe they were flares but
 there was no smoke, mist or haze around them. i kept taking
 pictures and video of them until they were completely out of
 sight. one by one they started dropping or dripping what looked
 like fireballs. then they kind of "flashed" on and off and
 disappeared. after the first one did this it looked like they
 moved into a triangle, then side by side, then they were gone.
 when we watched the video we still couldnt figure out what
 exactly it was. it was overtop of a heavy residential area,
 close to an airport. we never heard if anyone else saw them
 also. in november we saw a program on ufo s that talked about
 mufon. there also was a video of ufo s, that was taken in
 florida, 2 years ago that looked identical to our video.
 completly identical, but they never gave any explaination of
 what it might have been. id be more than happy to share my video
 and pictures with someone if they think they can solve our
 mystery.

Sighting report:   while driving on interstate 10 heading west
 from new orleans to baton rouge. i was on the i-10 about 10
 miles outside of new orleans. i was on the part of the i-10 that
 crosses over the southwestern edge of lake pontchartrain. it was
 a partly cloudy day and i saw a bright flash that was behind a
 cloud. now this may sound like lightning but there was something
 unusual about it because it was mostly a sunny morning around
 6:30 am. it almost looked like several camera flashes went off
 behind this white cloud. it was really something special. there
 were several flashes within about 1-2 seconds no sound. this is
 when it got real interseting. i continued to watch the cloud
 when a bright round ballshaped object came out from behind the
 cloud. it was round and looked like a small sun about the size
 of a softball. it moved a little to the right (west to east) and
 then took of at about a 35 degree angle upward. i was out of
 sight within a second so whatever it was was travelling at an
 incredible speed. i really don t beleive in ufo s as et s but
 this was either some kind of natural phenomenon like ball
 lightning or it really was some type of vehicle. the only thing
 though. since it looked like a small ball of fire it really
 didn t strike me as a craft. it seemed more like a natural
 event. i emailed a local weathermen and his reply was "i have no
 idea what it was"

fyi

Sighting report:   the sighting occurred on sunday, march 13,
 2005.  the time of the event was somewhere between 11am and 1pm,
 respectfully.  as i drove up the watterson expressway on-ramp
 located next to the mall st. matthews heading towards the
 interchange with interstate 64 (westerly direction), i noticed a
 small black object in sky over interstate 64 from that distance
 (at least 3-4 football fields away).  at first i thought it was
 one of those ballons car dealerships hang above their lots to
 get your attention.  as i went under i64 i became afraid when i
 saw that the object was a perfectly circular and flat.  black on
 the bottom and reflective metal-like surface on the top.  it
 stayed in the same position for quit sometime.  i pulled off the
 shoulder and watched it for at least another 5 minutes before it
 went out of view.  i called the police and local tv stations,
 but no one reported anything to anyone as far as i can tell.  i
 am considering checking with the local airport to see if they
 recorded anything unknown on their radar.

Sighting report:
on 10/26/2004 @ 9:11 pm, i was in out in my backyard in rural sw kansas 
looking at the southern sky, on a clear night. i had my camera with me =
because i wanted to see how well the pictures would come out, for the =
following night of the full moon eclipse. the sky was very clear, and =
the stars were bright, as i was looking at the heavens , when i saw =
something moving in the sky very strange. it was moving very fast up and =
down, and horizontal. i could see that it had lights on it that were =
different than a normal aircraft, and was in space. i could see the that =
it was up close to the stars, but too far to get a really good sighting. =
so, i took a picture of it with my hpix935 digital camera. later that =
evening, i down loaded the photo from my camera to my laptop. i looked =
at the photo in the windows photo program, and zoomed in on it. from the =
photo you can see that it is some type of craft, and it s colors, as =
well as the stars in the background. i believe that it was something =
that was very interesting, so i showed the image to several other local =
people, and asked their opinion. we all agreed that it should be =
forwarded to an expert for analyst. please let me know what your opinion =
is?  if you would like to contact me by phone, you can reach me at =
480/832-0891. thank you, for your =
cooperation.<http://photos.Msn.Com/viewing/album.Aspx?Pst=3d8nk2an1b!1lc0=
gyplxdieob0r3mgnzqkuv1wt!4uygvw9a*g7cpccbzzaf6oewqomll4a*hma7cpl!Txumzaja=
%24%24>=20
      taken 10/26/04
      lakin,kansas
    =20


sincerely,

jeff kunz
po box 253
lakin, ks 67860=20
i

Sighting report:   it was about 9 to 930pm march 30th. the
 weather was clear. it was about a quarter of a mile away from my
 girlfriend and i. it seemed to be a pentagon shape with 3 dim
 white lights on the top of it in a triangular pattern. there
 were many other lights in the middle of it. it was dark almost
 black. it floated from east to west, as we were facing south. it
 was over a place called the baker university wetlands. we saw it
 for about 2 to 3 minutes and it kept going until it was out of
 view. it also made no noise at all and was quite large. jimmy
 beason

Sighting report:   febuary 5, 2005. around 8:30. hazy/ alittle
 bit cloudy. close encounter of the first kind (ufo  appeared not
 to notice surroundings or witnesses). color:
 blue,red,yellow,orange. triangular w/ lights at each corner w/
 one light in middle, blinking. the top light was brightest. near
 east horizon. heading north. went in diamond formation,
 disapeered the reappeared in the diamond formation. traveled
 slowly. stopped and headed south, then went back. after five
 minutes, it slowed down then sped back up many times. encounter
 was approximintly ten minuteslong.

Sighting report:   it started at 9:05. it was in the east. there
 was cloud coverage.We thought it was a car reflectingonto the
 clouds. then it repeated the formation for an hour.It headed
 south then turned east. then we noticed a bright light in the
 clouds. the lights disapeered. my companions were mark vanunen,
 kevin hunt, and morgan fahrnow (who spotted the unusual
 nocturnal light.)

Sighting report:   good morning.I dont know if mufon has got any
 reports from co.Kerry,ireland?But the skys all most every
 evening has lots of strange objects moveing about.I myself have
 seen lots of strange objects of all colours,and shapes.The
 conditions are always good when seen!Dates are from 2003 to the
 present day.Thank you.

Sighting report:   of course not a single person believed this
 when we radioed this in from our location. it was an extremely
 large triangular craft with red glowing lights underneath it,
 fading in and out. it was a good distance out, bout three
 clicks. flying really low above the tree line. nothing like we
 have seen before. we see aircraft daily here in the warzone.
 someone knows about this besides us, right after it dissapeared,
 aircraft appeared in its location circling the area as if too
 find it, or shoot it down. made the report, but only recieved
 laughs, but we saw this huge craft with our own eyes.

Sighting report:   at about 8:40 p.M. on march 21, 2005, i was
 driving north on michigan road (us 421) from zionsville towards
 my house, located just north of 146th street (cr 300s).  the sky
 was clear.  as i approached the stoplight at the intersection of
 146th street and michigan road i noticed up in the sky, just a
 bit to my right and at what appeared to be several thousand feet
 up, a line of three bright orangy-yellow lights - similar to the
 color and intensity of warning lights on highways at night.  the
 line of three lights was moving slowly to the north.  at first i
 thought i was seeing a large airplane - i momentarily thought it
 might be a c5a or a 747 that was flying low - but then
 remembered that neither one of these planes would have three
 lights of this color in a row (wingtip-center-wingtip), so it
 then struck me that this was something i had never seen before. 
 i thus brought what i saw to the attention of my wife (sitting
 next to me) and my son (sitting in the back seat), who both
 looked up and said they saw the same thing i described and were
 as confused as i was regarding what we were looking at.    after
 about three seconds, one of the lights dimmed and then went out,
 then it came back on as the others dimmed and went out, and then
 the one that had gone out the first time and came back on again
 dimmed and went off.  by this time we had turned into our
 subdivision, so i parked the car so my sone and i could get out
 and try to see the lights again.  we did; this time, though, we
 only saw two and they were several miles away, but still headed
 in a northerly direction.  as before, after about ten seconds,
 the two lights dimmed and then went out.  my son and i continued
 to watch the sky for ten more minutes, but never saw the lights
 again, so we got back in the car and drove home, getting there
 about 9:00 p.M.  my interest piqued, i then went outside to see
 if i saw the lights again.  i did.  at about 9:10, i again saw
 three lights, of the same color but not the same intensity, as
 by now they appeared to be about 15 miles north of where i was,
 seemingly over the town of kirklin, in.  what i saw this time
 was two lights in a line and one light above the one on the
 left.  they stayed on for about 15 seconds, then the leftmost of
 the two dimmed and went out and then the other two dimmed and
 went out.  about five minutes later, in the same spot, i saw two
 of the three lights come one again, for about 10 seconds before
 then dimmed and went out.  i stayed outside for about 10 more
 minutes but never saw the lights again, so i went inside for the
 night.  for the record, i called the exectutive airport near out
 house to ask if anyone there knew of anything going on - they
 didn t, and hadn t seen the lights - and i called the newsroom
 at the indianapolis star to report what i had seen, but was told
 i was the only person who had called that evening.  i still
 haven t a clue what my son, my wife, and i saw, but after
 reading some of the postings from the april 2004 flap over north
 central indiana i realized that other people have seen the same
 thing i saw, so now i am really interested in learning more. 
 please feel free to contact me if you need any additional
 information.  thank you.

Sighting report:   i took digital pictures near austin on sunday
 january 23, 2005. when i looked at the pictures later one of
 them had a small object which looks like a ufo. i did not see
 anything at the time. the pictures right before and after showed
 nothing. 

give me an email address to send the digital pictures for
 analysis.

i have a local friend you can also contact
david harrienger
in austin, texas
(512) 394-0714
gran899@flash.Net

Sighting report:   we was playing foot and saw somthing shiny falling out of the sky and it was waving back and forth it got brighter and round with an dome on top then it stoped and took off in to the other county
Sighting report:   i saw a ufo in our house.It is around us

Sighting report:   the object was traveling fast. going se -tree top level . made to stops and dissapeared. was glowing wnite with blue around it. no noise. on sunday,february 6, 1230 at night. saw about 2 minutes.

Sighting report:   on february 24 at l1:31 i was up walking the
 house, i looked out my back window, i was a bright
 light-traveling south, it was probably the size of a large
 truck. traveling pretty fast. i watched it and in about 2
 minutes it was out of sight. no noise . i know you think i am
 crazy mut i always know when they are around me. thanks.

Sighting report:   i didn t really see a ufo but i am trying to
 find out about missing time. it seems that for the last three
 years- especially this year- that no matter how many times i
 reset my clocks and watches- the next day or so- the times
 aren t in synch any more. at first i thought it was bad
 batteries in my watch or alarm clock but then my husband s
 electric alarm clock was off too. it is not just the colcks in
 our house but in my car as well. i am always resetting it or
 resetting my watch to match my car- or  something of the sorts.
 is there a natural phenom as to why our "time" keeps getting
 fragged? is there something magnetic in the ground that would
 cause this? or am i just paranoid because i am begginning to
 never know what time it really is?!
my husband thinks i am crazy for researching this and trying to
 find answers. he thinks i am just over tired from working and
 balancing time with our infant son. this "missing time" started
 before i was pregnant- and got more noticable recently. 
maybe he is right and i am just being over-reactive.
i would still like a second opinion.

Sighting report:   at 9:30 pm on 3/12/2005 my friend, wife and i
 were out side talking. my wife looked up and saw a light that
 looked like a star it was moving all over the place real fastand
 then it took off over the gulf. it is a real clear night and we
 all saw it. this is realy strang because the night before at
 about 7:50 the tampa bay area felt and heard loud noise it shook
 houses for three countys it was even onthe news. thay said it
 was a sonic boom from 2 f18s landing at mc dill afb. i have
 lived close to a afb. most of my life and never herd anything
 like that. it also registered 2.7 on the ricter scale. my friend
 told me to send this site. i dont now if the military is testing
 or not. so i thought i would report this to you thanks. bob

Sighting report:   this event occurred either on july 4, 1995 or
 1996 with the possibility of it being 1996.  i know it was july
 4th of the year because we were at my sister-in-law s house in
 the chapel trail section of western pembroke pines, fl.  it was
 after dark (somewhere around 9pm edt) and we were lighting off
 fireworks in her back yard.  the night was overcast as no stars
 were visible.  as we were watching our own fireworks as well as
 those of the area surrounding, i noticed a round, slow moving
 object with an orange glow to it moving in the clouds towards us
 from the east.  it was not moving fast, but the speed of a
 conventional aircraft.  it was not the shape of a conventional
 aircraft, either commercial airliner, private small aircraft,
 balloon or blimp.  it made no sound as it passed overhead in a
 straight line of flight from due east to due west.  i pointed it
 out and others in the party observed it as i did.  it continued
 on its westardly path and i went to my wife s van (this is what
 makes the exact year of the event hard to pinpoint.  she
 purchased it in 1994, it was a 1995 model and it was either 1995
 or 1996 as she had had it for some time by then and i can t
 remember if it was the year before or the year of the vacation
 we took shortly after this particular 4th of july) as i had a
 pair of binoculars in the drivers side storage bin on the door. 
 i continued to observe the object as i approached the van while
 walking from the east side of the house (rear) to the west side
 (front) along the side of the house (north).  by the time i got
 to the van and retrieved the binoculars, the object had
 disappeared from sight.  i scanned the western sky with the
 binoculars but could not see it.  as the object had approached
 from the east, it was an oval.  overhead, it was circular and as
 it headed off to the west, it was oval again.  this is
 attributed to the perspective of seeing a circular object from
 below.  it maintained a uniform orange glow throughout the
 sighting, never changing in brightness or intensity.  i
 apologize for not being able to pinpoint the exact year of this
 sighting.  i had always meant to report it years ago but for
 whatever reason, i never did.  ten or so years is better than
 never doing it, i guess, huh?

Sighting report:   unusual flying, lighted, object encounter,

on january 30th 2005, my father, hobart c. wilcox, and i, jan r.
 wilcox, began a return trip to our home in st. petersburg
 florida, from my cousin92s home in butler alabama.  we rose early
 and started our journey at 5:30 am. we were traveling by car, a
 1994 dodge caravan. i was driving, with my father sitting in the
 right front passenger seat. we were heading south on highway 17.
 the weather was damp and cold (45 degrees) with a slight mist
 but no fog. at about 6:00 am a few miles outside of silas
 alabama, while it was still quite dark, i noticed a very bright,
 pulsing, bluish white light ahead of me and to the left of the
 highway.  the light was pulsing on and off at about one second
 intervals. the cadence and color of the light was very much like
 microwave tower strobes but was much more powerful, illuminating
 a rather large area of the forest tree tops directly beneath it.
 the duration of the illuminations was also much longer than the
 quick blips the tower strobes make. i asked my father if he
 could see this odd phenomenon and he said he could see it
 clearly. we were driving at about 55 to 60 mph. after
 continually observing and traveling about a mile, my father who
 has been a civilian pilot for many years after retiring from the
 military with 22 years of search and rescue missions on board
 both fixed wing aircraft and helicopters, said the object,
 appeared to be moving at a pace similar to ours as the angle of
 inclination was remaining constant and we could both see the
 edge of the approximate 100 yard wide illuminated circle moving
 across the tree tops. both my father and i have military
 training in the observation of moving objects, night and day, as
 well as on the land, water, and sky. neither one of us has ever
 personally seen anything exactly like this light display
 before.
  after driving on about two more miles with this pulsing light
 pacing just ahead of us and to the left keeping a steady
 elevation of about 50 feet above the tree tops, we approached
 the city limits of silas. at this point the light suddenly
 stopped moving with us and fell behind. i then slowed to the 35
 mph speed limit as we passed through silas but i watched the
 light continue to pulse in my side rear view mirror. then it
 just went dark and disappeared from our view.
 after driving on through the sleeping town of silas (we did not
 see a soul on the streets nor did we meet another car coming or
 going during this time), which only took a few minutes, as it is
 a very small rural town. my father and i began to discuss the
 possibilities of what may have been the source of this strange
 light, when i again noticed a pulsing light in front of us but
 at a very high altitude. it was hard to tell if this was the
 same light as it was now very small, but it had the same cadence
 and pulsing pattern and duration as the large light we had
 observed some moments before.  then quite suddenly the light
 descended, quickly moving back toward the outskirts of silas
 which was then a mile or so behind us, grew in size and
 intensity for a couple of pulses then disappeared again. 
 we never saw it again although we did see many radio and
 microwave tower lights, which we easily identified as such until
 the dawn and early morning sun rose. my father and i discussed
 the incident at length as we drove on toward florida and we both
 agreed the only craft that we knew of that could mimic the
 flight characteristics of the object we saw would be a
 helicopter. however, if it was a helicopter, we asked the
 question of why its search light was pulsing instead of being a
 steady beam of light. also it is pretty hard to determine what
 purpose and/or what type of helicopter would be flying around an
 hour or so before dawn, buzzing a small rural town and forest in
 the middle of nowhere. an interesting footnote to this encounter
 is that later that morning as we drove on through the florida
 panhandle we saw signs indicating we were close to eglin air
 force base. then i remembered that i had seen some videos shot
 during a ufo flap in and around the eglin afb area in the late
 1980=92s and some of the objects captured on those videos behaved
 and looked remarkably like the one my father and i had just
 witnessed. i also remembered that mufon was credited in this
 discovery channel ufo program with having investigated many of
 these sightings.
 unfortunately we did not have any equipment with us to record
 what we had seen so we just have our testimony and i realize
 that is not considered as reliable evidence, but i just thought
 you might be interested to know that apparently there are still
 strange lights in the skies in and around the florida panhandle
 area.

sincerely,
jan r. wilcox
hobart c. wilcox
1/30/05

Sighting report:   daate:  fri. jan. 21, 2005
time:  5:10 pm
place: lakeland, fl.
street: south florida ave.
area:  sw area of lakeland. 
time:  5 - 8 minutes.
weather:  cool. 70 s? clear sky w/ 2 patches of puffy clouds to
 my left and one to the right.
description:  i was traveling in my car heading south on south
 florida ave. i noticed two incoming planes to our small local
 airport.  the first was a familiar jet, and the second was an
 old craft that was perhaps closer to the 40 s. following the
 second craft, (stopped at a red light)i noticed a large, round
 silver object in the sw sky above where both planes had flown
 into lakeland and then on to the airport.  holding up a pencil,
 it was approx. the size of a round eraser end at the end of a
 pencil.  i first thought it was the sun reflecting on a plane,
 but the sun had set.  then i thought it might be a helicopter
 with a light on the front, but the light was too large and it
 wasn t moving. then, i thought perhaps it might be an
 experimental plane such as those that come in to our sun n  fun
 in april. (later, i checked with a flight safety man from our
 airport, asking a series of questions, and he said experimentals
 would not have large lights) here is the sequence:  the light
 did not flicker, but remained bright and steady before going out
 each time.
1.  a large silver object with relection.
2.  it changed to a large light.
3.  it imploded - disappeared.
4.  next stop light, a smaller light appeared.
5.  it imploded - disappeared.
6.  next stop light, a third and even smaller light appeared.
7. it imploded - disappeared.
8. the ususual military jets that fly overhead on a regular
 basis, then appeared and was seen above where the object/light
 was seen.
9. two days later, going in the same direction, i saw the same
 familiar military jet, which normally flies at an extremely high
 altitude, was seen flying towards the area where i had the
 sighting.  the jet circled the area, leaving a small round trail
 where the object had been seen, and then turned completely
 around and went back in the opposite direction.  i see these
 jets regularly across our skies, and i ve never seen one down
 that low or perfom that kind of maneuver. they normally travel
 across the sky in a straight line. 
note:  earlier that day, high frequency to r ear followed by pain
 and a nose bleed.  two hours later, sighting.
important to note for me:   92 encounter began from that same
 area at 5:30, with craft, entities, and followed by an energy
 field to room two weeks later.  
*i would appreciate a contact from mufon, as i have been trying
 to find a way to report a story to the journal.  
*my journals have stopped arriving at my home and i am trying to
 get help from the post office. 
* i have filed a report with nuforc as to the extent of the
 activities i have been experiencing over the last several years.
 thanks to mary margaret, bland pugh and to peter davenport for
 their help in the past and for any assistance and followup they
 can give. thanks to john schuessler for his leadership. 
 lakeland does not have a local director, and i look to mufon for
 their assistance.

Sighting report:   clear sky, cool to cold, february 1952, sioux
 city iowa.

long cylindric object with hemispheric ends. no wings, tail,
 engines, noise, no metal seams, no rivets, no windows. noticed
 when it was several miles away coming from the north along the
 river bluffs. 

i was looking west and on the bluffs above riverside. first
 noticed due to an intermittent annoying bright blue light
 flashing on my right eye, right side. looking to the north the
 light quit and i didn t notice anything unusual. looking to the
 west the blue strobing, flashing, or glinting returned. i looked
 down at the ground to see if anything was in the grass glinting
 in the sunlight. nothing. i then stared at the area where it
 seemed to be coming from, finally i saw a very small circle with
 the internal portion about the same color as the atmosphere, it
 was very close to the bluffs. i watched as it approached getting
 larger as it got closer. i could see it come past mt lucia in
 stone park, it was still a circle.
 
eventually it was close enough i could see it had a cylinder
 shape rather than circular, it was now approximately over the
 junction of military road and riverside blvd. my thought was it
 may be a commercial airliner in trouble to be this low and close
 to the hills, the sioux city airport was to the south several
 miles, beyond the missouri river. as it got closer i braced
 myself for the sound that was sure to be loud. as it went by
 there was nothing. i was close enough that had there been rivets
 and seams they would have easily been seen.

i was about 400 feet above the river basin, it was about 600
 feet. in distance it was probably 1000 feet away (est), it was
 about the size of a large airliner, moving about thirty miles an
 hour. the last i saw it was when it passed over the missouri
 river towards the airport. rather than diving down it just
 lowered in a flat descent. the color was that of highly polished
 bare steel.

total time of the incident was probably twenty or so minutes.
 later by the next night up to 8000 people from the riverside
 area reported an aircraft crashing near the missouri river. it
 was reported by the tower that gen curtis lemay s takeoff was
 held while the runway cleared. i understand it was flying
 approximately four feet off the ground as it cleared the
 runway.

i have never reported this to anyone, have only told my wife and
 children about it. i did not nor do i want any publicity. my
 intent is to document and provide the information to someone
 that can add it to the list of sightings. i had the opportunity
 of witnessing this craft longer than any other person. 

in looking at coordinates and geomagnetic mapping techniques
 instrumentation i find it would be similar to our remote
 instrumentation of other terrain. 

i have searched and watched for any other sightings of similar
 shaped object, so far i have seen none. i wanted to report this
 before my memory fades, i am 67 years old, a retired electrical
 engineer, and a naval aviation electronics tecnician and flight
 crewman veteran (1956 - 1960 vaw 11). i have designed very
 complex and sophisticated space science payloads for the naval
 research laboratory and the university of groningen among
 others. while an engineering student i worked at the u of iowa
 physics research center headed by dr james a. van allen.

one other strange incident. several years ago at 12:05 am an
 intense bright light (similar color to a standard flourescent
 light) lit our bedroom brighter than daylight and lasting for
 several seconds. reports the next day had others reporting a
 bright light traveling north to south over tampa bay waking
 people on both sides of the bay (approximately 17 miles wide).

i would appreciate feedback on either of the incidents should you
 have any.

Sighting report:   
in orlando florida on february 1st 2005 at 8:20am local time, i
 saw an object about the size of a basketball in the sky. at
 first i thought it was a baloon, but there was very little wind
 and the object was moving towards the wind. this made me
 curious, and i began to look more closely at it. i quickly
 realized it was not a baloon and may have quite possibly been
 what wwii air force pilots called a "foo fighter". as i said;
 the object was about the size of a basketball, dark grey in
 color, was not perfectly spherical, but spherical with a smaller
 protruding lobe visible on the one side that i was looking at.
 the objects  altitude was approximately 150 to 200 feet, and was
 traveling from the northeast to the southwest at 30 to 35 mph. i
 observed the object for 60 to 90 seconds as it flew in a
 perfectly straight and level flight path untill i could no
 longer see it. the object had no lights of any kind, and made no
 sound. i was on the corner of semeron blvd. (s.R. 436) and
 michigan street. this area is just a couple of miles from
 orlando international airport. this intersection is actually on
 oia s glide path, and the object was headed towards the
 airport.The weather was good; 55 degrees fahrenheit, very light
 cirrus clouds, and a light variable breeze.
